headline: Spinach Enchiladas
description: These spinach enchiladas are quick and easy. Made with common pantry ingredients, they're ready in under 45 minutes for your family to enjoy.

video.description: Simple vegetarian enchiladas star spinach and two kinds of cheese.
video.name: Spinach Enchiladas

name: Spinach Enchiladas
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach , thawed, drained and squeezed dry
2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add green onions and garlic; cook and stir until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in spinach and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and mix in 1 cup Monterey Jack, ricotta cheese, and sour cream.

Warm one tortilla in a skillet over medium heat until flexible, about 15 seconds. Repeat to warm remaining tortillas. Spoon about 1/4 cup spinach mixture onto the center of each tortilla, roll tortilla around filling, and place into a 9x13-inch baking dish with the seam facing down. Pour enchilada sauce over top and sprinkle with remaining 1 cup Monterey Jack.
Bake in the preheated oven until sauce is bubbling and cheese is lightly browned at the edges, 15 to 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I cut the Ricatta cheese in half and subbed in low-fat cottage cheese for the other half. I also used fresh spinach because I had it and substituted olive oil for the butter. I also added salad shrimp to them. Yummy! I might try to sub out some of the sour cream for Greek yogurt next time to reduce some of the fat.
Good. Restaurant quality.
It was first time we did spinach enchiladas at home. It was easy enough to follow
I used red enchilada sauce … store bought. Absolutely delish and what an easy recipe. I used two 9x9 dishes so I could freeze one of them . Definitely will make this again. Great recipe.
Easy to make and we loved it.
LOVE!!

I had to change some for our tastes. Mozzarella cheese for sure and cumin, cilantro, oregano and cayenne. Fresh spinach a must. Other than that, add additional toppings with queso fresco! Next time I want to add fresh jalapenos to the spinach sautee!

Really tasty! I used fresh spinach instead of frozen, and I sprinkled a little cumin, salt, and pepper over the top before baking. My meat eating husband liked it so much that he went back for seconds.

This recipe reminds of those art pictures in cheap motels. Hand painted sure, but made in some giant factory. But go ahead, eat a lot of this. You're doctor will love you. I won't say that it came out that bad but it wasn't that good either. It all the ingredients that I love but mixed together, not the taste. Too rich for me. And too much trouble for what you get. Rather have a spinach omelette instead.

I was thrilled to find this recipe after my husband brought some spinach in from the garden. I didn't have ricotta or Monterey Jack Cheese, so I substituted salt-free cheese. I added in some beef tenderloin that I stir-fried and then chopped into small pieces. I made Authentic Enchilada Sauce from this site, and the dish turned out great.
Me and my son love it.
We absolutely Loved it!! Delicious and easy to make!

I followed the recipe pretty closely, although I only had flour tortillas and I sprayed the bottom of the pan. Also I mixed pepper Jack and cheddar cheese. I used green enchilada sauce. Very tasty and easy!

I knew when I read the recipe that I would have to add some heat. I left out the sour cream, it tends to get too runny, and probably used the entire 15 ounce container of ricotta. Then I added 2 chopped jalapenos and 1/2 chopped red bell pepper. I added 2 teaspoons of salt to my vegetable mixture and added a half teaspoon of cayenne pepper and 2 teaspoons of chili powder. Because I added vegetables to the spinach and the entire tub of ricotta we ended up with 16 enchiladas. I will make these again, I may take them to Thanksgiving dinner as a side dish.
No changes to recipe and it’s always good. Even my 10 yr old granddaughter loves them and she hates any type of spinach. I think it’s all the cheese!
Delicious and super easy to make (and I'm a new cook). Added shrimp for a little extra. Thanks so much for posting this recipe. I'm sure I'll make it again and again.

Husband approved! I did make some changes based on what ingredients I had on hand. I used flour tortillas, sweet onions, and added the spices recommended in the video. It is a keeper and will try it with corn tortillas next time.

Came out great- ended up with 19 6” enchiladas (row of 2 x 8 in a 13x9 Pyrex & 3 in a smaller dish for a packed lunch- see pic)! Made with suggested chili powder, cumin & an onion powder blend… Also added a TBSP of Sriracha for subtle heat… The next time I make this, I’ll sauté some diced red onions or shallots for an extra depth of flavor & a tad more Sriracha to make it mild spicy
Great recipe! Only change I made was to add shredded chicken to it. It came out delicious either way.
It was easy to make and turned out great. I'll be making it again. A different kind of enchilada. I made my own enchilada sauce because I didn't have any store-bought.
a fan. not enough flavor

I have made this as written and this last time I used low fat ricotta and Greek yogurt instead of sour cream and it was just as delicious. I do use medium green enchilada sauce. I think it might be a little bland if not for the little extra kick of the sauce.
I will absolutely make this again. It was relatively easy and tasted really good. I added some cooke shredded chicken and that made it really g.
The Best!
It's almost perfect. I don't change a thing but I do serve it with our family's Spanish Rice recipe...and marguaritas, if desired, of course!

Used fresh Spinach instead and roasted an eggplant (sliced, about 30 minutes at 375) to use in the spinach mixture. Didn’t add too much flavor, but made it bit more nutritious and heartier. Worked well with these rather rich enchiladas.
Tasty, lite and delicious!
My family and I loved this. Lots of great flavor. I added a bit more hot peppers as we like it on the hotter side. Easy to make and will be cooking this again.

Yum!! Used cottage cheese instead of ricotta and it was just fine. Used a larger portion of enchilada sauce which made it perfectly spicy! Also added some sauteed mushrooms to filling. Perfect non meat option for a main dish!!

I made this according to the recipe. I wish I had looked at all of the other reviews first. The filling was too bland. So many of the other reviews gave it 5 stars, but they made many suggestions for changes.

It was excellent. We did make minor changes:
Fresh spinach instead of frozen
Add a 16 oz can black beans, well rinsed
Used Mayan chilli powder. We’ve been sharing the recipe all wee
Very tasty, will make again
Really good when you need to cook something in a pinch. It's a bit heavy to regularly eat. Perfect for busy nights.
I added shrimp to mine, it was delicious!

I made a few changes, but I would love it as is, I'm sure. Because I'm gluten-free and also because of what I had in the garden that I wanted to use, I subbed several ingredients: used chard for the spinach, lots of chives plus a sliver of onion for the green onions. Also added a jalapeno to the onion/garlic mix. Didn't have Jack cheese, but Chihuahua shreds worked beautifully.
Enchilada sauce has flour in it, so I made my own version of it with gluten-free flour. Started with a little GF flour in oil/butter, added tomato paste, water, salsa (from a jar), garlic powder, cumin, oregano, salt and lemon juice. 
I had a cooked, partial chicken breast to use, so I shredded it and added it to the filling, expanding the volume slightly and making 12 enchiladas (they still fit in the pan with 2 lengthwise along one edge). 
Superb! Seems fool-proof and super-flexible. The ricotta is key. We both loved it.

Decent recipe! The only thing I changed was omitting the sour cream (tried to reduce some fat where I could) and it tasted perfectly fine without it!
The filling was a tad bland to me, but perhaps I didn't use the right shredded cheese. We only had mozzarella on hand.
Next time I'll add more spices (per other reviewers recommendations) including, perhaps, a little salt.
Came out good. I enjoyed these.

Growing up in San Diego, CA, I have had access to amazing Mexican food...authentic as well as Americanized. This recipe sounded good, but I wasn't sure what to expect. Some reviewers hated it, many loved it, and some were indifferent. I ended up really enjoying it, but depending upon how others made them, I can understand why they may not have been as fond.

First, there is a lot of spinach in each enchilada. Depending upon your relationship with spinach, I would recommend adjusting amount to suit your preferences. Also, frozen and fresh spinach taste much different, try both to see which you like better (cook down fresh spinach first as it contains a lot of water). And if you just don't like it, you can easily sub in other veggies...roasted poblano/pasilla peppers would definitely go well with the ricotta and could add a bit of spiciness.

Second, green vs. red enchilada sauce makes a world of difference. I've never been very fond of red, canned enchilada sauce...it just lacks in flavor imo. Homemade sauce in any variety is almost always better, but not everyone has the time to make their own enchilada sauce. We did make these both ways and while the red ones weren't bad, using green sauce (canned) really gave them so much more flavor.

Third, if you have had ricotta before, you know it is a very soft, creamy, mild cheese with a hint of sweetness. It is not going to lend a lot of flavor to the dish. That didn't bother me because it paired well with the green enchi
Mine could of used a little more spinach, but it was very tasty.
It sounded so good but the final product met critism from my family. Complaints included blandness and "too spinachy".
Easy and delicious! I added the three spices as recommended and it definitely enhanced the taste.
This recipe is great! It’s fast, easy and absolutely delicious! My friends and family were impressed!
added mushroom for meat texture.
Delish! I've made this multiple times and added summer squash, onions, whatever I had on hand. Highly recommend. Served it to guests and they also loved it.
Added some ground beef, a can of diced mild chilis and used Pepper Jack cheese. Everyone loved it.
did not like
SO CREAMY AND THE CHILDREN LOVED IT.
Made it exact to recipe and we loved them! Was afraid my wife would not as she’s not a big melted cheese fan. They are so creamy and delicious. Great recipe!
Don't sweat it if the tortillas split. Just serve it up like a casserole. Be heavy-handed with the cheese. I suggest serving with a side of white rice seasoned with lime juice and chopped cilantro.
It was ok. I made exactly as the recipe is and it was just missing spice it was bland.

I've been making these for a couple of years now, and have adapted the recipe over time. We loved how cheesy and creamy these enchiladas were the first time I made them, but they were on the bland side. I add corn, red bell pepper, Mexican oregano, cumin and some medium chili powder to give them a kick. Now this is one of my go-to recipes!

I added some corn, cut off the cob and charred, because I had some left over. I added a little cumin and oregano. I didn't have any enchilada sauce, but a friend gave me some homemade salsa verde that I added on top. The filling is super delicious and was totally adaptable into a baked roll up even without the sauce!
This was delicious and will make it again!
Delicious. May try it with Kale next time or fresh spinach from the garden. Will make again.
The cross of Italian and mexican was too off for my family.
I’d give it a five, except I thought it needed spiced up a bit.
Easy and very tasty.
Could generally use more seasoning, but overall, a great way to get introduced to making enchiladas.
Love this recipe! Easy to make and yummy!!
It wasn't as flavorful as I thought this dish would turn out to be. The sour cream and cottage cheese overpowered the spinach.
A versatile recipe that this family loves. We’ve made it as printed and we’re delighted with the result. It’s also great with some shredded chicken or even bacon.
Excellent filling, just make sure you get good enchilada sauce. I prefer the green sauce personally.

Very tasty
followed other suggestions and added, cumin, salt, pepper and fresh jalapenos.

I love this recipe! I have made cheese enchiladas in the past, and they always come out of the oven rather flat. The only change I made was beating an egg into the cheese mixture, like when I am making ricotta filling for cannelloni, lasagna, pizza topping, etc. They turned out beautiful and held their round shape! Husband is a meat eater but really liked these too, very rich, tasty, and filling.
Made it in accordance to the recipe. Turned out great. A keeper.
Very good!
Added shredded chicken to the cheese mixture. Turned out great. Will def make again.
The recipe was easy to make and turned out well but it seemed a little bland, maybe a little more spinach next time.
I used low carb tortillas and we love it. Very easy and delicious.

Very tasty and easy. I'm sure it's me but I can never roll up corn tortillas gracefully - they tend to break, regardless of how much I hear them first. I'll make this again, using more flavorful cheese and seasonings, but definitely delicious as-is.

I added 1 medium onion first and sauteed that before adding the garlic and green onions which just added a little bulk to the filling. I also used low fat cottage cheese instead of ricotta and low fat sour cream to lower the caloric impact a bit. Final adjustment was we used red enchilada sauce because we couldn't find green. Overall very yummy!
I have made this several times and it's always a hit.

I made my own enchilada sauce. I added a teaspoon of cornstarch stirred and dissolved in a quarter cup of water to a half jar of salsa. I heated it up to thicken it and then poured it over the enchiladas before I baked them. It was delicious. This turned out to be comfort food.

Both my niece and I are meatless so I made these for us at a potluck. EVERYONE loved them. I tried with fresh spinach but the frozen cooks much better. I found no need to warm the tortillas to wrap, just did straight out of the bag. I prefer green sauce over red but either way, they are fantastic!
I will make again. I will use more spinach and less cheese. Very good
Easy to make and the family loved it! Will make it again.

We really like these, but they lacked one thing, fresh green chile. I added green chile to the cheese and spinach mixture. And if you don't want the corn tortillas to crack you really need to heat them with oil. When I make casserole enchiladas you can use the corn tortillas right out of the bag, but with rolled you really need to fry them in oil first.

My family loved this recipe. The only additional ingredient I used was shrimp. I followed the first two steps with minced garlic and scallions, then added shrimp. I seasoned the shrimp with garlic salt and Old Bay. Then I followed the rest of the steps. Glad I come across this recipe!
I think next time I make this, I will add fajita chicken.
I opted for adding some green chilies and spices. There wasn't much to improve on...they're amazing!
Very good!
Absolutely loved it.
We absolutely love spinach enchiladas. I doubled the spinach and kept everything else the same for a higher spinach to cheese ratio. It was perfect.
My mouth is watering as I type...I followed the recipe and added the spices as mentioned in the video. This is a new family favorite! Thanks for sharing this recipe!

I love Mexican food and lots of spice, so I added a can of black beans and a can of green chilies. This added more flavor and increased the dietary fiber. An entire can of chilies is likely too much for most people, but as I said, I love spice. Instead of warming the tortillas separately, I layered them as if this were a lasagna. Much easier. I will likely make this again.
The video shows addition of cumin, chili powder and onion powder, which are not listed in the recipe.
These were a mild and delicious enchilada per recipe. To spice them up would be easy enough by adding a chopped jalapeno.

I used 16 oz of fresh spinach instead. I wilted the spinach first with some olive oil and let it sit on a strainer for a few minutes. I made this for my wife and mother and they both cleared their plates.

I've made this twice. The first time was with canned red enchilada sauce and the other night I made my own sauce (Thanks to Cookie & Kate) . Both were easy and delicious but the canned sauce had a little bit of an under cooked tomato taste. Kate's recipe was awesome. This dish is out of this world and reminds this Italian of manicotti.
I omitted the ricotta cheese and used fresh spinach. They came out perfect and yummy!

I’ve been wanting to try this for a while and glad I did. These are delicious. Made exactly as directed and this recipe made 6 enchiladas for us in a 7x11 pan. I made a homemade enchilada sauce and we really enjoyed. Will definitely make again.

These were so easy to make and tasted great, I did add 1 tsp. of cumin, 1 tsp. of paprika and a tsp. of onion powder to the spinach mixture as suggested by others, I really think it gave the spinach a little pick-up. Definitely will make again.
I added small can balck olives and chopped cooked chicken ... we all really enjoyed it.. easy peasy

So delish ! My husband actually stopped eating ( I was a bit worried ) he looked at me and said " this is so... good "!!! .. It really was very good , I did add minced jalapeño and green chilies like others suggested, so it was a bit spicy , but that's how we like them . Definitely will make again !

Several changes. Doubled recipe. Made w/ almost all organic, including two 8oz bags of frozen spinach, two cans of Hatch organic enchilada sauce. Nice contrast of acid to spinach. Added sautéed crimini mushrooms, two cans of diced green chili’s, red onions; the rec’d onion powder, chili/cumin powder and two tablesooons of roasted garlic paste. Mixed Mont. Jack and super sharp white cheddar. 
Yielded one pan of 10 enchiladas, then vacuum froze another eight. 
Delicious for two meals to start. Of course, lotsa sour cream on! Black Goya beans baked mixed with fresh organic salsa on side. Winner fer sure! This Cal-Tex couple is very happy!

I did what another recipe had done and combined a cup of sour cream with 7 oz. of green salsa, then spread it out on the bottom of the baking pan. I forgot the green onions, used 4 garlic cubes (instead of fresh since the cubes mix better) and added garlic powder and sea salt to taste. I used fresh and frozen spinach, a 16 oz. bag of frozen spinach plus about 1/2 to 3/4 of a bag of fresh spinach that I rough chopped. We like white flour tortillas instead of corn so that's what I went with. We will definitely be making this again, everyone agreed that they were the best enchiladas I've ever made. Yummy yum yummy
Excellent! Easy to make, great flavor. My vegetarian daughter absolutely loved them as did her carnivore husband! It will be a regular on our menu.
I added diced chilies to spice it up! I like green sauce husband likes red so I split it!

I loved this recipe! My husband thought there was too much cheese. I anticipated the cheese overload so added a can of salmon which changed up the flavour a lot. Sounds strange but we eat a lot of salmon and we both enjoyed it. The next time I make this recipe, I will cut back on some of the cheese I sprinkle on the top. The Green Enchilada Sauce was perfect for us. Not to much heat. Will make this recipe again.
